translated: The Chapter on Pairs, the Text on the Modes of Conveying a Two- fold Base

original: 8.46. Upādāduka🔽Naupādā dhammaṁ paṭicca naupādā dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naupādā dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: upādāduka  na aupādā dhammam paṭicca na aupādā dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na aupādā dhammam paṭicca

original: nanoupādā dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naupādā dhammaṁ paṭicca naupādā ca nanoupādā🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na no upādā dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na aupādā dhammam paṭicca na aupādā ca na no upādā  ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With an undeled state as condition there arises an undeled state, a condition by way of root. With an undeled state as condition there arises a deled state, a condition by way of root. With an undeled state as condition there arise both an undeled state and a deled state, a condition by way of root.

original: Nanoupādā dhammaṁ paṭicca naupādā dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na noupādāḥ dhammam paṭicca na upādāḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a deled state as condition there arises an undeled state, a condition by way of root.

original: Naupādā ca nanoupādā ca dhammaṁ paṭicca naupādā dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na aupādā ca na noupādā ca dhammam paṭicca na aupādā dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With both an undeled state and a deled state as condition there arises an undeled state, a condition by way of root. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… purejāte āsevane ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe tīṇi pe purejāte āsevane ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: In the case of root, there are five; in the case of object, there are three; … in the case of prior, and in the case of pursuit, there is one; … in the case of nongreed, there are five.
